page.title: 03FARMING-ANIMALS. Headcorn.
page.content: The{Sheep}bred locally are Romney and {Southdown}which produce strong sturdy lambs in the Spring.With modern know- ledge and good husbandry, many ewes give birth to twins-sometimes triplets Sheep go through a"Dip"of disinfectant to prevent disease,in Summer they are shorn,the fleeces sold for spinning wool.Some lambs are slaughtered and the meat is sold locally,others go to market. Dairy herds consist of{Jersey or{Fresian}breeds which give a high milk yield and rich cream. Like sheep, the cows graze outside most of the year,supplimented with winter feed of hay or silage.Bullocks are also grazed during the Summer and put into covered yards for wintering.{Horses}are kept for riding; free range{Chicken}provide eggs and{Ducks}and{Geese}are fattened for the table.
